titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: James Gittings was born in 1927 and graduated from Juniata College in 1949, having interrupted his education to serve in the army during World War II. He obtained a Master's degree in Journalism from Columbia Graduate School of Journalism and also did graduate work at Pittsburgh-Xenia Theological Seminary. Appointed in 1957 by the Board of Foreign Missions of the former United Presbyterian Church of North America to served as a journalist in East Asia, he wrote for Presbyterian Life, United Presbyterian curriculum publications, Kerygma Features, and a variety of other publications. Gittings was the editor of the quarterly An Asian Notebook and director of the Office of Overseas Publicity IBC-COC.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of James A. Gittings. Materials include: subject files, including typed drafts of articles; newspaper and magazine clippings; photographs; programs; and correspondence. Also included are scrapbooks of Gittings' articles and publications (1964-1968) and a 1967 photo album of Japan, including photographs of religious services, street scenes, and individuals. In addition there is a book-length typed draft of "UP is an enemy" by Gittings (possibly unpublished).

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
